1.text: Hear, my sons, the instruction of a father, and attend to know understanding:

2.text: For I give you good doctrine; forsake ye not my law.

3.text: For I was a son unto my father, tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother.

4.text: And he taught me, and said unto me, Let thine heart retain my words; keep my commandments, and live:

5.text: Get wisdom, get understanding; forget it not, neither decline from the words of my mouth:

6.text: Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee; love her, and she shall keep thee.

7.text: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: yea, with all thou hast gotten get understanding.

8.text: Exalt her, and she shall promote thee: she shall bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her.

9.text: She shall give to thine head a chaplet of grace: a crown of beauty shall she deliver to thee.

10.text: Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many.

11.text: I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in paths of uprightness.

12.text: When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and if thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.

13.text: Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go: keep her; for she is thy life.

14.text: Enter not into the path of the wicked, and walk not in the way of evil men.

15.text: Avoid it, pass not by it; turn from it, and pass on.

16.text: For they sleep not, except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall.

17.text: For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.

18.text: But the path of the righteous is as the shining light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.

19.text: The way of the wicked is as darkness: they know not at what they stumble.

20.text: My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.

21.text: Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thine heart.

22.text: For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.

23.text: Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.

24.text: Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee.

25.text: Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.

26.text: Make level the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.

27.text: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left: remove thy foot from evil.
